name: Data-Fa14
tagline: CSE Training Workshops in Data Analytics, Fall 2014 • DCL L440, 1–3 pm
body:
All workshops will be held in L440 Digital Computer Laboratory, an EWS computer laboratory in the basement. There is no sign-up for this series—walk-ins are welcome and encouraged! # [Introduction to R, Part 1](#r1) ### Sep. 8, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 This workshop targets students with some programming experience and little to no prior exposure to the statistical and data analysis language R. We will conduct a hands-on walkthrough of basic R features and packages. We will cover the following topics: - Reading and cleaning data - Major data types and their uses - Useful functions - Data display [How to install R Studio on EWS workstations](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/data-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/install_Rstudio.md) [Link to lesson](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/data-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/R1_intro.pdf?raw=true) [Link to exercises](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/data-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/R1_exercises.pdf?raw=true) # [Introduction to R, Part 2](#r2) ### Sep. 15, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 This tutorial continues the introduction to R begun previously, including new topics such as importing packages. [Link to lesson](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/data-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/R2_intro.md) [Link to capstone exercise](https://github.com/uiuc-cse/data-fa14/blob/gh-pages/lessons/R2_exercise_capstone.pdf?raw=true) # [Pandas (Python Data Analysis) Library](#pandas) ### Sep. 17, 9:00–11:00 • DCL L440 The [Pandas](http://pandas.pydata.org/) module provides an R-like interface for manipulating and analyzing data sets and their statistics. # Introduction Big Data and Analytics (Seminar by Big Data and Analytics Council) ### Sep. 25, 5:00 pm • 1002 Lincoln Hall Although not part of the CSE workshop series, we recommend this talk hosted by the student group Big Data and Analytics Council which will cover Big Data and its applications in a popular manner to those interested in applying data analysis techniques to their research and coursework. # [Data Mining Applications](#mining) ### Sep. 29, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 # [Machine Learning Applications](#ml) ### Oct. 6, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 # [Machine Learning in Python](#sklearn) ### Oct. 22, 9:00–11:00 • DCL L440 # [IllinoisNLPCloud](#nlpcloud) ### Oct. 23, 9:00–11:00 am • DCL L440 _Presented by Dr Mark Sammons and Hao Wu of the [Cognitive Computation Group](http://cogcomp.cs.illinois.edu/). Please note the updated date and time._ Come learn how to perform cloud processing of natural language, whether your interest is business intelligence, computer science, computational linguistics, or text mining. [IllinoisCloudNLP](http://cogcomp.cs.illinois.edu/page/software) makes it straightforward for experts and nonexperts alike to process large texts as needed. ### Setup We will follow the instructions [here](http://cogcomp.cs.illinois.edu/page/software_view/CloudNLP). Unless you already have an [Amazon Web Services](https://aws.amazon.com/) account, you will use a CSE training account uniquely assigned to you in the workshop. (Good user practice: you typically don't want to expose this information, but since I'll reset it immediately after the workshop it's "okay" here.)

- On your EWS machine, please open a terminal window to work in and execute the following code: module load sun-jdk/1.7.0-latest-el6-x86_64 - Follow the instructions [here](http://cogcomp.cs.illinois.edu/page/software_view/CloudNLP). - When your terminal output reads [info] play - Application started (Prod) [info] play - Listening for HTTP on /0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0:9000 then navigate to [`http://127.0.0.1:9000/`](http://127.0.0.1:9000/). - To monitor jobs, you can log in to the [AWS site](https://uiuc-cse.signin.aws.amazon.com/console) with the username assigned as `csetrainingXX` and password `Capricorn1`, then select ‘EC2’ and `Monitor Instances` on the left. There you can see your machine instances running on the cloud and some data about their execution. # [KNIME Graphical Analytics](#knime) ### Oct. 27, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 KNIME is an open platform for sophisticated data mining and statistics on your data. The visual workbench combines data access, transformation, investigation, predictive analytics, and visualization in one package. Come to this hands-on workshop and get started today! # [Hadoop and MapReduce](#hadoop) ### Nov. 10, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 # [SQL, Pig, etc.](#pig) ### Nov. 17, 1:00–3:00 pm • DCL L440 # About These Workshops ### Contributors Neal Davis and Yuanzhi Qi developed these materials. This content is available under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. ![CC-BY-3.0](https://i.creativecommons.org/l/by/3.0/88x31.png) # Contact If you have any questions about course availability, concepts, or content, please contact Neal Davis, Training Coördinator for Computational Science & Engineering, at davis68 at illinois dot edu.
